{{cpp/io/basic_istream/title|seekg}}

{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|1=
basic_istream&amp; seekg( pos_type pos );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|1=
basic_istream&amp; seekg( off_type off, std::ios_base::seekdir dir );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Sets input position indicator of the current associated {{tt|streambuf}} object.

{{rev begin}}
{{rev|since=c++11|Before doing anything else, {{tt|seekg}} clears {{tt|eofbit}}.}}
{{rev end}}

{{tt|seekg}} behaves as {{named req|UnformattedInputFunction}}, except that {{lc|gcount()}} is not affected. After constructing and checking the sentry object,

@1@ if {{c|1=fail() != true}}, sets the input position indicator to absolute (relative to the beginning of the file) value {{c|pos}}. Specifically, executes {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;pubseekpos(pos, std::ios_base::in)}} ({{ltt|cpp/io/basic_streambuf/pubseekpos}}, in turn, calls seekpos of the specific buffer, such as {{l2tt|cpp/io/basic_filebuf/seekpos}}, {{l2tt|cpp/io/basic_stringbuf/seekpos}}, or {{l2tt|cpp/io/strstreambuf/seekpos}}). In case of failure, calls {{c|setstate(std::ios_base::failbit)}}.
@2@ if {{c|1=fail() != true}}, sets the input position indicator to position {{c|off}}, relative to position, defined by {{c|dir}}. Specifically, executes {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;pubseekoff(off, dir, std::ios_base::in)}}. In case of failure, calls {{c|setstate(std::ios_base::failbit)}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|pos|absolute position to set the input position indicator to}}
{{par|off|relative position (positive or negative) to set the input position indicator to}}
{{par|dir|defines base position to apply the relative offset to. It can be one of the following constants:
{{cpp/io/ios_base/seekdir consts}}}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

===Exceptions===
{{include|cpp/io/stream exceptions}}

===Notes===
{{lc|seekg(n)}} is not necessarily equivalent to {{lc|seekg(n, ios::beg)}}. {{c|std::basic_ifstream}}, for example, requires the absolute position {{lc|n}} to come from {{lc|tellg()}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string str = "Hello, world";
    std::istringstream in(str);
    std::string word1, word2;
    
    in &gt;&gt; word1;
    in.seekg(0); // rewind
    in &gt;&gt; word2;
    
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "word1 = " &lt;&lt; word1 &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "word2 = " &lt;&lt; word2 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
word1 = Hello,
word2 = Hello,
}}
